document.title: English Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools March 2024

73787AB9BE6948DBA71C60657DB2EA4D.description:
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of all sources, including the Internet, Artificial
Intelligence (AI), and new technologies as they develop.

49BB608C00344892AE5D57960BC77952.description:
Give credit for information quoted or paraphrased using standard citations (e.g., author,
article title, webpage, and publication date).

2B636FD5EC08421AB6DC7AF897875DBC.description: Organize and share findings in formal and informal oral or written formats.

48FAF329677746089251066546EB8F84.description:
Develop notes that include important concepts and summaries, including quoting,
summarizing, and paraphrasing research findings, avoiding plagiarism by using own words
and following ethical and legal guidelines for gathering and using information.

DD05C575D9CE4FF49E5343FB2153FB9C.description:
Organize and synthesize information from multiple sources (primary, secondary, digital,
and print) evaluating the relevance, usefulness, validity, and credibility of each source.

528442BA4AB34BB8B037FEE983A0E74A.description: Collect information from multiple sources, using search terms effectively.

2031A0926840449F9C39263192428278.description:
Formulate appropriately narrow questions about a research topic and refocus the inquiry
when appropriate.

3E3DA9E450A6499FA79CE677268C2B63.description:
The student will conduct research and read a series of conceptually related texts on
selected topics to build knowledge on grade-six content and texts, solve problems, and
support cross-curricular learning.

CB453D29645B4C18BAB7C461248E27F8.description:
Explain the characteristics and analyze the effectiveness of a variety of media messages by
considering the results and/or impact on the intended audience.

56C10062FA114C6E90CFCD66577E2EF5.description: Explain how media messages are intentionally constructed to impact a specific audience.

B4018E485AE24F1499D775F6D63ED4ED.description:
Interpret information presented in diverse media formats and explain how it contributes to
the topic.

EB34B685B327454D80D63BBB8539C46F.description:
Craft and publish audience-specific media messages that present claims and findings in a
logical sequence.

75277B86DFE34F12AD66D75FEFDDDBA1.description:
Use media and visual literacy skills to select, organize, and create multimodal content that
articulates the purpose of the presentation, using two or more communication modes to
make meaning (e.g., still or moving images, gestures, spoken language, and written
language).

5A15EAFE465B424CB75E2305710C9AF1.description: Referencing source material as appropriate during the presentation.

49683F4D90CC415C8299B605F7D8E4C0.description:
Encouraging audience participation through planned interactions (e.g., questioning,
discussion, gathering responses, and movement).

E507F4DC640849FE8F0CB1F49FF27F07.description:
Using nonverbal skills, such as proper posture and stance, gestures, and eye movement
to enhance the overall message.

E1A58E0C39624982BA59BF34C33726D2.description:
Using verbal communication skills, such as volume, tone, and enunciation to enhance
the overall message.

FEBF827AC1C648BE86EDA614099B26D4.description: Using language, vocabulary, and style appropriate to the audience, topic, and purpose.

57380EDF89B346E2BA62A5DB6C889378.description: Providing evidence to support the main idea.

6F0DCA4735A74940A8070F08AF9E947C.description: Clearly communicating information in an organized or succinct manner.

233CE66C701542CB937295613DDE75AC.description: Report orally on a topic or present an opinion. This includes:

EFBC1ED2FFD64B68866A4A788D72DBEF.description:
Evaluating the effectiveness of participant interactions and one’s own contributions to
the collaborative work.

D2C2B4E903EC483CA5974A4599B8C0FD.description:
Paraphrasing and summarizing key ideas being discussed by using ample evidence,
examples, or details to support opinions and conclusions.

1B74CF95BE9C4E12AC6F43D7DA0812A5.description:
Communicating agreement or tactful disagreement with others’ ideas, using carefully
constructed responses.

CD79EC0FBDC746199E4C5413D0840807.description: Asking relevant questions to clarify others’ perspectives.

867BA53D65074110A1DBAF356E1E41D9.description:
Working respectfully by building on others’ ideas and showing value for others’ ideas
and contributions.

3254857EF6CE499CBFEA1481C2E1C4B1.description:
Listening actively through verbal and nonverbal communication and using agreed-upon
discussion rules.

2221BB0CEC074935BEDEAB3F88A7C665.description:
Facilitate and contribute to a range of sustained collaborative discussions with diverse
partners on grade six topics and texts. This includes:

9756D478D80F492E86E806B4F05D72E9.description:
The student will develop effective oral communication and collaboration skills to build a
community of learners that process, understand, and interpret content together.

A0D8BD1B240B4D2D9A1D74084D7CEB8B.description: Consult reference materials to check and correct spelling.

8C0FA572547E407E805A091A888CA5B2.description: Recognize and consistently spell frequently used words accurately.

062F4D3827784FCC86E8974E32E7E9D8.description: Use and punctuate dialogue and direct quotations appropriately in writing.

A67E24D1B24D44D3AFE62E0B430EBC43.description:
Construct complete sentences with appropriate punctuation, avoiding comma splices and
run-ons in writing.

47E6783D0FAD4D9D9EE90ACAD9AF1EB5.description: Form and use often confusing verbs (e.g., lie/lay, sit/set, rise/raise) correctly in sentences.

EACE672FC5F249898663B352C9B6BD49.description:
Use phrases and clauses within a sentence and apply appropriate subject-verb agreement
when speaking and writing.

64347ABA645A4B97BED4A33777DB2707.description:
Use adverbs to modify verbs, adjectives, and other adverbs to express manner, place, time,
frequency, degree, and level of certainty precisely when speaking and writing.

D702DBB789174FECB90C874332A9B389.description:
Use pronoun-antecedent agreement, including indefinite and reflexive pronouns when
speaking and writing.

D1939DC1485842E099836763EED1A261.description:
Construct simple, compound, and complex sentences to communicate ideas clearly and add
variety to writing.

3B7DE1818A024F25B8D4AA45B5E34C9A.description:
The student will use the conventions of Standard English when speaking and writing,
differentiating between contexts that call for formal English and situations where informal
discourse is more appropriate.

92D04C96F5C1476CB3FB3A740EBD797D.description:
Self-and peer-edit for capitalization, spelling, punctuation, sentence structure,
paragraphing, and Standard English (See Language Usage for grade level expectations).

241172C337EC47BAA3CE71A0CD6A8FED.description:
Revise writing for clarity of content, word choice, sentence variety, and transition among
paragraphs.

FB550A6F6AD04704BEAC3AD7A094874D.description: Providing a concluding statement or section.

A0EBB2902AEC4FF6879AE44FDFA1AF23.description: Expanding and embedding ideas to create sentence variety.

A0A81E4F86884C56A44468A5C884853B.description: Selecting vocabulary and information to enhance the central idea, tone, and voice.

FC1FCB1A8B0C4C4B883F95E03BFC5342.description:
Using transitions to show relationships between ideas, signal a shift or change in the
writer’s thoughts, and make sentences clearer.

95BE6A180097482B9B918365D0843FF1.description:
Elaborating and supporting ideas, using relevant facts, definitions, details, quotations,
and/or examples.

A43C7F27C2A949299597874D085BB585.description:
Establishing a central idea incorporating evidence and maintaining an organized
structure to fit the form and topic.

A15DF92E26414C549F9C64261AE2AFE2.description: Composing a thesis statement that focuses the topic and introduces the piece clearly.

DFEE447F3B9846AFBB93267AE8F2BC64.description:
Generate and organize ideas using the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing)
to develop multi-paragraph texts. This includes:

57BF6E72768246099BA91B8777C0171A.description:
Write reflectively in response to text(s) read to demonstrate thinking with details,
examples, and other evidence from the text(s).

10C17888D0224ACEA0000677894A52ED.description: Write persuasively about topics or texts, including media messages, supporting welldefined claims with clear reasons and evidence that are logically grouped.

8A2509C27814487F86CE4542BC2629FB.description:
Write expository texts to examine a topic or concept, logically conveying ideas and
information using text structures such as description, comparison, or cause-effect to create
cohesion.

47A8AA29F1B34CFEA358877E4C747197.description:
Write narratives to entertain, to share a personal experience, or to alter an existing story
that uses narrative techniques to develop the characters, event(s), and experience(s).

2C355FC751AE4B5F8C549CB249F13F8D.description:
The student will compose various works for diverse audiences and purposes, linked to
grade six content and texts.

A4B2B8ECEDD74E54904B14E945303F06.description: See Kindergarten through grade five for Foundations for Writing standards.

D3DB486CDF6A4138B709E2155F2B50B8.description:
Compare and contrast one author’s presentation of ideas or events with another’s,
identifying where the texts agree or disagree.

7EB4EC15ED6D4A2FA78DB314EEC60558.description:
Describe ideas within and between selections including how specific sentences, paragraphs,
or sections contribute to the development of ideas.

CD3835A844CD4BFD9F4318A65652667F.description:
Explain how an author establishes and conveys a perspective or purpose in an
informational text.

C02AB4D941F84FD6AD11370A9EAA0284.description:
Explain how an author’s word choice, organizational pattern, and language structure
convey the author’s purpose.

C9CAD2CB5F7C485CAB91FD88CD106C26.description:
Determine the purpose of text features (e.g., boldface and italics type; type set in color;
underlining; graphics and photographs; and headings and subheadings).

6FABB22ABA104DBF9B5F1175FD606883.description:
Trace the argument and specific claims in texts, distinguishing claims that are supported by
evidence and reasons, from claims that are not.

565536FA999F4347896C8D5D48AC10A4.description:
Describe how a key individual, event or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in
historical, scientific, or technical texts (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

B66C83CAB40D4FDAAA94817180CDA935.description:
Summarize texts, including their main idea(s) and how they are developed with specific
details.

4EECFCDF539748FFBFBCF76D3468CACD.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from grade-level complex informational texts read.

D4560BF46DD84420A144372E73A525D0.description:
Compare and contrast details in two or more paired literary fiction and nonfiction texts on
the same topic or with similar themes, including how chapters, scenes, or stanzas work
together to provide the overall structure of each text.

540441CD516544BE902E34B16BAB43D0.description:
Describe how the interactions between individuals, settings, events, and ideas within a text
influence one another.

7BA0D95094924467ABFCBEC5DEA66094.description:
Explain how an author develops the point of view (e.g., first-person, third person limited,
third-person omniscient) of the narrator or speaker in a text and influences how events are
described in stories, plays, or poems.

C95F6BB4AD614A908D7F0129F7314FA0.description:
Explain elements of author’s style as purposeful choices (e.g., imagery, figurative
language, and word choice) to develop tone.

A4C2B4575BF540F6BCE94A7811ED91B3.description:
Describe the poetic elements in prose and poetry (e.g., rhyme, rhythm, repetition,
alliteration, and onomatopoeia) and their intended impact on the reader.

BC37A28676464AE8A9D1D5D74CE75358.description: Explain the role of the protagonist and antagonist on plot events.

A0962D38A49041889DF58E03CF846523.description: Explain how static and dynamic characters impact the plot.

72DBD37ADEAB488B9AFA2D8312A00107.description:
Differentiate between internal and external conflicts (e.g., individual vs. Individual,
individual vs. Nature, individual vs. Society, individual vs. Technology, and individual vs.
Self) and explain how they impact character development and plot.

31B8253CA4AA41FC9573049881BEB2A0.description:
Describe plot developments in stories and dramas by examining the exposition, initiating
event, central conflict, rising action, climax, falling action, and resolution.

28B14A96793340DEA84CEDF62A424053.description:
Summarize texts, including determining the central theme of stories, plays, or poems, and
how they are conveyed through specific details.

0AEEECCFA264499B9B86269E00B2D645.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from a variety of grade-level complex literary texts read to include short stories,
literary nonfiction, novels, poetry, and drama.

600C168B7C6A4934A053393E24F1AEC9.description:
Use newly learned words and phrases in multiple contexts, including in students’
discussions and speaking and writing activities.

9CD9030EE43242FE88A41D3B212824A6.description:
Use general and specialized word-reference materials, print and digital, to identify word
origins, derivations, and pronunciations.

2485B0A5595C4C6494224415FD38C342.description:
Clarify the meaning of an unknown word or select the applicable definition of a word from
a text by using word reference materials.

49AF587D9BD24A1DACE3770AF89273D4.description:
Explain the construction and meaning of figurative language, including simile, hyperbole,
metaphor, and personification.

4D327144849744D79124995D40CB6E4A.description:
Use the relationship between particular words, including synonyms and antonyms to better
understand each word.

72486B0D7A9D498A825959F61C437566.description:
Apply knowledge of Greek and Latin roots and affixes to predict the meaning of unfamiliar
words.

D381EDB5546C4E5D94ADCB229B06BC8F.description:
Use context and sentence structure to determine multiple meanings of words and clarify the
meanings of unfamiliar words and phrases.

69A3EB83ADC648B8AE360B206ECB4DE7.description:
Develop and accurately use general academic language and content-specific vocabulary by
listening to, reading, and discussing a variety of grade-six texts and topics.

51F1FC0D83FF48D495040DF75634B842.description:
The student will systematically build vocabulary and word knowledge based on grade
six content and texts.

88584BB9D63644DD93D78A5A5B1E777A.description:
Use reading strategies as needed to aid and monitor comprehension when encountering
challenging sections of text. These sense-making strategies attend to text structure,
common organizational structures, summarizing, asking questions of the text, and others
(Reading Strategies 3-12).

8068D788AC3C42709255AF3EE51EE297.description:
Regularly engage in reading a series of conceptually related texts organized around topics
of study to build knowledge and vocabulary (These texts should be at a range of
complexity level so students can read the texts independently, with peers, or with modest
support.). Use this background knowledge as context for new learning (Deep Reading on
Topics to Build Knowledge and Vocabulary, K-12).

0E31AA9FED6C40CD96845D07F955EFBC.description:
When responding to text through discussion and/or writing, draw several pieces of
evidence from grade-level complex texts to support claims, conclusions, and inferences,
including quoting or paraphrasing from texts accurately and tracing where relevant
evidence is located (Textual Evidence, K-12).

D5D39EA1CBA04B91BE5722FA74240363.description:
Proficiently read and comprehend a variety of literary and informational texts that exhibit
complexity at the lower range of the grade 6-8 band (See the Quantitative and Qualitative
Analysis chart for determining complexity in the Appendix.) (Text Complexity, 2-12).

986DEF7F8B974F589BC498C27AEABCAB.description:
Read a variety of grade-level complex text with accuracy, automaticity, appropriate rate,
and meaningful expression in successive readings to support comprehension. Monitor
while reading to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding when
necessary (Reading Fluency, K-12).

AD0C6632D01C4BA58A63B77C84AC1C7C.description:
The student will build knowledge and comprehension skills from reading a range of
challenging, content-rich texts. This includes fluently reading and gathering evidence from
grade-level complex texts, reading widely on topics to gain purposeful knowledge and
vocabulary, and using reading strategies when comprehension breaks down.

0A94765ACB7544D39D04CCF58D51D2E6.description: Developing Skilled Readers and Building Reading Stamina

D153BF1CF6E1488B84F9677AE8E3F984.description: See Kindergarten through grade five for the Foundations for Reading standards.
